description_txt: stated on June 22, 2010 in in a U.S. Senate Democratic primary debate:
quote_txt: "The first time he ever voted as a Democrat was here in Florida in 2008. He only voted four times in his life, and he's asking Floridians to come out and vote for him."

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2010 in an interview on Sean Hannity's show on Fox News:
quote_txt: It was President Obama's "inaction that caused over three weeks to go by before he even approved the governor's plan to protect our marsh."

description_txt: stated on April 27, 2010:
quote_txt: When he worked for AT&T, he "was responsible for large parts in a $5 billion organization."

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2010 in a hearing on the Supreme Court nomination of Elena Kagan:
quote_txt: "The ABA's own criteria for a judicial nominee call for, among other things, at least 12 years' experience in the practice of law, and they mean actual practice of law."

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2010 in a Democratic U.S. Senate debate against Rep. Kendrick Meek:
quote_txt: "If there were not derivatives, there would be no bank loans at all today."

description_txt: stated on June 27, 2010 in comments on 'Meet the Press':
quote_txt: "Phoenix, Arizona, is the No. 2 kidnapping capital of the world."

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2010 in comments on 'Meet The Press':
quote_txt: Canada "does spills into their water to practice in the event that this would happen. That is not allowed in the United States."

description_txt: stated on June 25, 2010 in a speech:

description_txt: stated on June 10, 2010 in for DuBose Porter's gubernatorial campaign:
quote_txt: Says he "fought against $3 billion in cuts to public education since 2003."
